programme.title: Vampire Skeletons
programme.desc: Documentary examining skeletons unearthed in Ireland that appear to be treated as revenants who might return from the dead to prey on the living.

programme.title: Haunted History
programme.desc: Experts visit the site of the Mad Butcher's murders in Cleveland, Ohio, where they hope spirits will help them crack one of the biggest unsolved crimes of the 1900s.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Morgan makes dangerous efforts to gather food, while Jake finds himself in wolf territory and Jason journeys further underground in search of raw iron ore.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: With a gruelling winter ahead, Jamie has employed his biggest heavy rescue team yet in preparation - and when a truck carrying a huge amount of lumber crashes, the team is faced with the first big wreck of the season.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The heaviest lift in two seasons pushes Jamie and the team to their limits, leaving them struggling to complete the rescue and get traffic on the Coquihalla Highway moving again.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: At the new shop, the Golds are surprised to find a bag of gems inside a former employee's desk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Gary Lineker hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with panellists Ross Noble and Samira Ahmed joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Julian Clary, Ross Noble, Bill Bailey and regular panellist Alan Davies know about jumpers, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy decides she wants to have a baby, but what she didn't expect was for the whole family to take a personal interest in the conception. Lee thinks he should be the one, of course - so he can't believe it when she reveals she is planning to have the child with another man. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star, with Katy Wix, Bobby Ball, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy is always looking for ways of improving her position in the world and sees another chance by befriending posh new neighbours Toby and Anna. But she hasn't reckoned on Lee dragging her right back down to earth. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the sitcom, with guest appearances from Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Stand-up comedians Ed Gamble, Katherine Ryan and Sindhu Vee are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the rise of train travel between cities led engineers to consider how to travel within them - leading to the development of the London Underground.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The spacecraft designed for the first manned mission to Mars, planned to launch by 2035, which requires the most powerful rocket ever built and a specially designed crew module.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Tardis takes Donna and the Doctor to the universe's largest library, which was sealed up and abandoned 100 years ago amid stories of terrifying living shadows within. With Colin Salmon and Steve Pemberton, and Alex Kingston making her first appearance as the mysterious River Song.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Doctor joins forces with Professor River Song as the Vashta Nerada advance, and is stunned by shocking revelations about his future. With guest stars Alex Kingston, Colin Salmon and Steve Pemberton.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: An unknown presence joins the Time Lord and a group of tourists trapped on a shuttle travelling across a distant planet. When a fellow passenger starts mimicking the Doctor, paranoia sweeps through the cabin. Guest starring Lesley Sharp (Scott & Bailey), Colin Morgan (Merlin) and David Troughton, son of the second Doctor, Patrick Troughton.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Singapore Grip
programme.desc: The Blacketts intensify their campaign to secure Matthew's allegiances and Walter remains unyielding, despite the Japanese bombing Singapore. As Vera nurses Matthew through his fevered delirium, the Major is warned not to trust her. Sylvia's brother Charlie rejoins his regiment and Ehrendorf volunteers, and Matthew makes a momentous decision.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Family
programme.desc: Anne Hegerty hosts a quiz show in which 16 families take part in a knock out tournament as they attempt to win the holiday of a lifetime and the title of Britain's Brightest Family. In the third episode, the Gavin family from Gloucestershire and the Curtis family from Kent battle for a place in the quarter-finals.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Half-way through ice season, desperation kicks in as teams bring in experimental equipment and infamous ex-employees to double production. It remains to be seen if the gambles will pay off.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike Kennedy risks an emergency landing on an Alaskan glacier, while Danny Thompson frees a $1.8million business jet from its hanger - by hand.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The staff of Orange County Choppers build a specialised trike for the last winning fan, Bryan King, who was left paralysed after a car accident.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds what he thinks is the finest-handling front wheel drive car, the Lotus Elan M100, and gives it a new lease of life.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Exploring the inner workings of the Skandi Arctic, the world's largest and most technologically advanced dive support ship.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes used to make pistons, paint rollers, parachutes and chimneys, and how these methods have evolved over the years with advances in technology.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind carbon dioxide cartridges, pretzels, scissor lifts and skating rinks.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which two college students were gunned down while parked in a quiet lovers' lane. Residents of the tiny community of Juliette, Georgia, were beside themselves with panic.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating the murder of a record store employee discover the crime was not motivated by money, and suspect a gang of bikers may have been involved.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for a Dogfight Kingpin
programme.desc: Two abused pit bulls are seized from dog fighters, 16 feral cats are rescued from an abandoned house and a lost bird is returned home.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris takes us into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets. A labrador is brought in with bulging eyeballs, and 60-year-old tortoise Hugo needs a mate.

programme.title: I Found the Gown
programme.desc: A bride finds her dream dress, but it requires much alteration by a seamstress. A woman has to consider her medical bills while trying to decide between two gowns, while a bride finds herself running out of time to make her choice. Meanwhile, Rick and Leslie find some good buys at a factory in Toronto.
